name: Vampiric Jade Statue
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Immutable Form
text: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
text: If the statue fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The statue makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, that creature becomes cursed by the statue. The curse lasts for 10 minutes. While the creature is cursed, the statue has advantage on all attacks against it.

action.name: Claws
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

The construct can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The construct regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bite
text: The statue makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Blood Reaper
text: All creatures currently cursed by the statue and within 20 feet of it take 5 necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Move
text: The statue moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

description:
A large, exquisitely carved jade statue of a vampire guards the tunnels in Isle of the Abbey, having been brought to life by dark magic. Its stone fangs draw blood that it then uses to work a curse on its victims.
Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 256
